content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals the negative of the fraction 32 over x, end fraction, plus x cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>32</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 4, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the instantaneous rate of change of <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
